abstract: Billionaire hedge fund manager Ray Dalio defends 'unusual' culture at his $150 billion company, Bridgewater Associates, defending its policy of 'radical transparency'; Bridgewater came under scrutiny after New York Times article reported on sexual harassment complaint against firm.

byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: During a hedge fund conference, the billionaire investor Ray Dalio responded to media scrutiny of the $150 billion firm’s “unusual” workplace culture.

headline.main: Bridgewater Manager Ray Dalio Defends His Firm’s ‘Radical Transparency’
headline.print_headline: Fund Manager Defends Firm and Its Culture as Transparent
